See you around :)', 'Update Due to some unforeseen circumstances we have to cancel this week’s heimfucc event. Hope to see you next time :)', 'Hello Everyone, 
Due to several issues the Heimbar Tutor had to leave the position.
Taking this opportunity we would like to highlight the fact that Heimbar is the main source of income for presidium and all the services we provide, fixed costs (i.e. printer etc), gym/kitchen equipments and so on, are funded based on our financial
management i.e. the money we earn from these events, no presidium member gets to keep any money from our earnings, it’s students money and it flows back to students in the form of events/services.

In the light of the current situation, we decided that the präsi as a whole will be in charge of Heimbar untill further notice, we plan to put transparent financial structures, stream line the stocking process, make it more self-sustained for the future tutors.
The präsi is undergoing financial reforms, which include fixing the above mentioned issues, analysing the situation, and getting a clear idea on how much Heimbar makes on average. We will ask for applications once these issues are resolved.

Heimbar events will be held on saturdays as usual so For Heimbar visitors nothing will change.

Until further notice me and @kirastaub will be your contact persons for Heimbar managerial inquiries/issues/etc. plus @doodle_131 will be the contact point for renting Heimbar and billiard room.

Thank You,

Your new tech tutor @WillyWillsWissen will be your contact person for printer related stuff from here on out.", "The new Waldhaus printer

It's insured against everything, including floods and hurricanes.

All the paper work is done, we're just waiting on a delivery date from the printer company, it shouldn't take too long now.

Thank you for your patience and have a nice weekend !", "As a part of our new year's celebration your presidium is hosting a firework show on the football field infront of Waldhaus between 11:30-12:30pm.

But you can drop by and observe as long as you don't interfere with the counting.", 'Good morning to all the democracy lovers here! Election starts now, you can vote in the red and blue building 🔥', 'Forwarded from the election leader- Timna.', "Waldhaus elections this Saturday, 03rd of December (Tomorrow)!

Dear habitants of Waldhaus,
This Saturday we will hold Waldhaus elections for this year's first term. You will be able to vote in person on one of the ballot booths in the entrance areas or remotely by telegram.

Who?
Every resident residing at Waldhaus in December 2022 (right now), so subtenants included, but people that have sublet their room and do not actually live here not. (It's simple: You live here --> you vote!)

When?
Saturday, 03rd of December (Tomorrow) from 8.30 am to 5.30 pm.

Where?
At one of the polling booths.
One will be in the entrance area of the red building, the other one will be at the entrance area of blue building.

Why?
Because we need you to
 - chose who will run this place next semester (you decide!)
 - help us to run a valid elections, for which we need a minimum participation

Also, free drink voucher given away to everyone voting!

Any questions? Contact me!

Wanting to vote remotely? Contact me as well!", "Hey everyone, 
short reminder for today's Waldhaus pub crawl. 
We will meet at 19.00 in front of Waldhaus for a getting to know each other part (no need to be shy, just come by) then we will be going to the city for the pub crawl.
Hint: You don't need to drink alkohol to be able to participate :)

Looking forward to see you soon☺️", 'Printer update :

Q: Why is the printer not working ?
A: As you may know, the printer was subject to vandalism a while ago, which left us - amongst other things - with a broken card reader and a damaged screen.
Since then we've been in talks with the company that we rented the printer from.
Q: Ok, but why is it taking so long to fix it ?
A: Fixing the printer could cost us anywhere from 600€ up to several thousands euros, which led us to the conclusion that returning it and renting a new one might be the optimal choice in this senario. 
Q: I have a card and I just want to print, when will it be resolved  ?!
A: as I've mentioned earlier: we've been in talks with our counterpart since the incident took place. There's nothing we could've done/could do to speed up the process without running the risk of making an under-informed decision that could unnecessarily cost our dorm hundreds if not thousands of €€€.
Q: So what's the current status of these "talks" that you're having with the printer company?
A: They reached out to us today per email after pondering over the issue for a while, they had two offers and wanted to talk on the phone. (Stand 30.11.22)

If you have any questions regarding the printer situation please drop by in the next präsi meeting.', 'The gamesnight will be in TV Room ( green building common room, in the middle of printer room and the room with the big round table) and start in 10 Minutes, so come by for a relaxed evening 😊', 'one piece will be one euro - but no need to hurry up, the cake will finish baking at around 16:15', 'Hello everybody :)

This time we will go to the Ego club together where we will benefit from some great discounts: 
● 50% discount on entrance fee 
● Welcome Drink 
● Free Shot 
 
However, before we start swinging the dancing leg, we will meet at the famous dormitory Waldhaus to kick off the night in good company with various games such as billard or flunkyball. 😎👍 
Just join and meet a lot of international and local students. Kick start your weekend with a good party! ✨️😜

 Registration link

 ESN-Saarbrucken Instagram post 
https://www.instagram.com/p/CcnVZ9asUHn/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=', '', 'Hello Everyone, 
Hope you guys are doing good. As a tradition we decided to continue with welcome event.

When?
On 23 April 2022 (Saturday), we want to organise multiple fun events for the new residents , current ones and friends. We would like to see how many people will be interested in attending. 

What ? 
The event will be one of it’s kind with 

 1. Waldhaus tour (all the places, insights, tips and tricks) 
 2. Easter egg hunt (riddles to solve,  prizes to win)
 3. Food & drinks( on reduced prices )
 4. Heimbar (The best way to end the day)

Who ? 
The event will be for all the Waldhaus residents, friends from outside are always welcomed 😄 . 

How ?
Exact time and details will be provided soon, just be there and everything will be explained

Why ?
We think it will be a  good kickstart to  meet new people, have new experience and reduce the early semester stress. 

Thank You
Your Presidium :D

P.S: More the people = More the motivation to make the event super cool.', 'Here is the protocol from last weeks meeting.', 'Heimcafé is open. 1 slice 1€', "Today at 16 o'clock Heimcafé will open with fresh marble cake😄", 'Heimbar is opened now🎉', 'Prepare yourself for tomorrows Heimbar🥳

---------------------------------------------

Meeting Point? Staatstheater
Event Location? It's a secret🤫

PS: bring drinks for pre heat up if you want
My advice: something you can shot", 'Weekly Event List(April 04-10)', '', 'Hi guys! Today im hosting ✨HEIMCAFE✨ at 16:00, serving chocolate chip cookies for 1euro each! hope to see you there :)', 'Hi guys

for this week it might actually be a little cold and bad weather but if a lot of people want to go anyways pls text me 

See u soon 😁👍🏻

The room numbers are formatted like the following:
<Building Number>-<Floor number>-<Room Number>

72-Blue
73-74 are yellow

if you interested in this trip, pre-register through the original post', "Dear ZiS-friends!

Join us for Slackline and active games. Walk on the suspended webbing and challenge your balance, concentration and play games with friends.


- Meeting point: Am Staden, Saarbrucken
- Date: Wednesday, 12th June, 2024
- Time: 19:00


Don’t forget to register as the spots are limited. Keep in mind that your registration is fully valid once you get the confirmation email from us (which will be sent later)!

Please register ONLY if you are sure that you are gonna participate as you may block someone else’s place. If you got our confirmation e-mail but can’t join the event anymore, please let us know as soon as possible, as we can give your spot to someone else.

Join us for our following event:
UniFilm: Night on Earth (OmU)
Audio: English; Subtitle: German

The price of the ticket will be on us. Other than that, you can bring your own food/snacks or you can buy popcorn or drinks from the stalls taking place inside the B4.1 (Audimax) building.

- Meeting point: Building B4.1 (Audimax) at Saarland University
- Date: Tuesday, June 11, 2024
- Time: 18:30

Don’t forget to register as the spots are limited. Keep in mind that your registration is fully valid once you get the confirmation email from us (which will be sent later)!

https://forms.gle/7TrZptygD6c344K5A

Please register ONLY if you are sure that you are gonna participate as you may block someone else’s place. If you got our confirmation e-mail but can’t join the event anymore, please let us know as soon as possible, as we can give your spot to someone else. 

See you there!
Yours ZiS-Team', "Join us on our ZiS-Excursion to Castle Eltz & Cochem on June 15 (Saturday) 
FORWARD THIS TO YOUR FRIENDS

You can hike or take the bus to Casle Eltz, you can choose.
We will be back in Saarbrücken latest at 18:42. You can still join the Asta-Festival in the evening or night (check until when the party will last).

The 15 EUR include the following:
- transportation/train tickets
- guided tour in Castle Eltz
- ice cream in Cochem
- support by the tutors

Note:
We will have more pre-registrations than participation spots and we will choose a subset of pre-registrations as final participants. This pre-registration form is open until Thursday (June 13) 20:00 o'clock or until all spots are taken. You will receive an email for confirmation or rejection. 
Questions? Write us to zis-exk@uni-saarland.de

Pre-registration link:
https://forms.gle/4JV19ydahc5oyWCK8", 'Dear ZiS-friends!

For this we will go near Saarbrücken to St. Wendel where we can enjoy their festival with different genres of music and dance.

- Meeting point: Saarbrücken Hauptbahnhof

ZiS', None, "Hey dear ZiS friends,\xa0 

We hope you're doing awesome! We're thrilled that you've been joining us in all the fun activities at our events—it's always a blast with you. 🌟\xa0 

We get it totally that sometimes life gets crazy. But we've noticed a few students turning into ghost participants recently.

Just a quick and kind reminder, we're like a big family preparing all of these wonderful events for you, and it's a bit tricky when some of our awesome peeps are missing from the celebration. 🎈 We get it completely when some urgent things pop up suddenly. But it would be cool and highly appreciated to have a heads-up from you if you are unable to make to the event. 

Here's the scoop: if you find yourself in a no-show jam a few times, we might have to give you a rain check for the next event (Black-list or List of Shame) 🌧️ We really don't want to do it, but we're serious about keeping the good vibes alive for everyone.

Let's keep the good times rolling, and we can't wait to see you at the next shindig!", "Dear ZiS-friends!

Your ZiS Team', None, "Hey dear ZiS friends,  
 
We hope you're doing awesome! We're thrilled that you've been joining us in all the fun activities at our events—it's always a blast with you. 🌟  
 
We get it totally that sometimes life gets crazy. But we've noticed a few students turning into ghost participants recently.
 
Just a quick and kind reminder, we're like a big family preparing all of these wonderful events for you, and it's a bit tricky when some of our awesome peeps are missing from the celebration. 🎈 We get it completely when some urgent things pop up suddenly. But it would be cool and highly appreciated to have a heads-up from you if you are unable to make to the event. 
 
Here's the scoop: if you find yourself in a no-show jam a few times, we might have to give you a rain check for the next event (Black-list or List of Shame) 🌧️ We really don't want to do it, but we're serious about keeping the good vibes alive for everyone.

Your ZiS Team', "Dear ZiS Friends,

We're excited to invite you to the History Museum of Saarland, where we'll explore the intriguing Saarbrücken castle complex from the Middle Ages and Renaissance. This journey will uncover historical gems, including parts of the medieval castle, a shooting chamber, 16th-century fortifications, a moat-based ballroom, and a dungeon.

We look forward to sharing this historical adventure with you.

Warm regards,

Your ZiS Team.

🌲 Destination: Schwarzenbergturm 
🏞️ Hiking Distance: Approx. 3km 
🗓️ Date: 31st August 
🕒 Time: 02:00 p.m

Get ready to connect with nature, make new friends, and conquer the trail to reach the stunning Schwarzenbergturm.

Your ZiS Team.', 'Hello guys! 
 
Join us this Saturday, April 15th, to see an exhibition “Influencer will save the world” of a German illustrator and comics author Eric Schwarz. The exhibition is dedicated to his book The Path. In the exhibition you will find sprayed hints, drawings and messages of the fictional influencer. They lead you to the book - the collected newsletters of this person, through which he/she communicates with the followers. The plan of the influencer is to lead the followers into a better future. # short summary
We heared about that international students have reported scam calls (even some lost money).
Keep in mind: German officials are too bureaucratic to ask for your money via phone or via mail. If you are not sure, ask first friends or your tutors or asta or whoever before you send money to anyone. It takes ages before you get a penalty fee here, so better wait and ask for help, if you are not sure. Don't forget: When you cannot pay via card in a lot of places here in Germany, you can definitely not finalize payments via phone calls.

######### full text

***PLEASE SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS****

Due to many students reporting scam calls, we ask our international students to be very careful!

Look out for❗️:
- Callers identifying themselves as police, government agency, bank clerk... (usually speaking English)
- Someone posing via text as work colleagues, friends, family
- Callers, who ask to disclose personal information (about bank account, personal details...)
- Callers threatening serious consequences (arresting you, suing you, stating they immediately need money)
- Asking for gift cards (google, apple...)

What to do🚫:
- Take a deep breath and end the call
- In case of a text messages from "friends/colleagues": before responding or doing anything else, verify the identity of the person (call/text them on the number that is KNOWN to you)
- Do not share ANY information!

Good to know✅:
- German authorities, your bank ect NEVER ask you via phone for personal details, bank account info and the like. They also never ask you for financial compensation in gift cards! And usually they do not speak English that well 😉
- Don't be afraid if you hung up on them! 
- Avoid answering unknown numbers

You can report unwanted callers to Bundesnetzagentur: https://www.bundesnetzagentur.de/DE/Vportal/AnfragenBeschwerden/Beschwerde_Aerger/start.html

In case you have shared information🆘:
- Make a list of the information you shared (name, bank details, gift card codes...)
- Report to your local police department! https://www.saarland.de/polizei/DE/onlinewache/onlinewache_node.html
- Shared any bank information? Immediatley inform your bank and ask for their protocol!', 'Here are the pictures of the ZiS-Excursion to Wiesbaden. See u next time :)
https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.411811334283810&type=3', 'ZiS-excursion to Wiesbaden (May 21; 15 EUR). 2 days left for pre-registration. Tell your friends, invite them to this channel.', 'Pictures of the ZiS-excursion to Saarburg&Trier :)
